backend/main.mo: Motoko actor that stores vitals readings (heart rate, BP, SpO2, temperature, respiratory rate) in a list with input validation, and exposes methods to add real or simulated readings and query them by date range or all at once.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping three implemented features (autonomous vitals monitoring service, dashboard autonomous status UI, and monitoring status pill) to their source files and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-sentence summaries of every frontend source file, serving as a quick reference for the project's frontend architecture.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base CSS file defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes including background, foreground, card, status, and sidebar tokens.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point that mounts the React app into a root div and loads the main TypeScript module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Sets up TanStack Router with a root layout route wrapping Dashboard, LogEntry, and History pages, all wrapped in a React Query QueryClientProvider.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: App shell component with a sticky header, logo, desktop/mobile navigation, and a teal pulsing monitoring status pill; mounts useAutonomousMonitor so the 30-second loop persists across all routes.
frontend/src/components/VitalCard.tsx: Reusable card component that displays a single vital sign's value, unit, status badge (normal/warning/critical), and clinical reference range, with a loading skeleton state.
frontend/src/components/VitalsAlertBanne: Dismissible alert banner component for out-of-range vitals with warning (amber) and critical (red) styles, plus an AlertsContainer that renders a list of such banners.
frontend/src/components/VitalsTable.tsx: Renders a sortable table of vitals readings with color-coded status indicators (normal/warning/critical) for each metric and an overall status dot per row.
frontend/src/components/VitalsTrendChart: Displays a Recharts line chart for a single vital sign over time, with optional reference lines for min/max thresholds and a custom tooltip.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries when the identity changes.
Custom hook that automatically submits simulated vitals readings to the backend every 30 seconds and exposes monitoring state including countdown, last recorded time, and errors.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context and provider, managing AuthClient creation, login/logout flow, and persisting identity across page reloads.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports React Query hooks for fetching the latest reading, all readings, and date-range-filtered readings, plus a mutation hook for adding new vitals readings.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet defining a medical-grade dark theme with OKLCH CSS variables for colors, custom utility classes for card glows and pulse animation, and font imports for Inter and JetBrains Mono.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx: Main dashboard page that displays the latest vitals reading as cards, shows autonomous monitoring status, and manages dismissible alerts for out-of-range vitals.
frontend/src/pages/History.tsx: History page that displays all past vitals readings in a tabbed view with trend charts and a table, supporting optional date-range filtering.
frontend/src/pages/LogEntry.tsx: Form page for manually entering and submitting a vitals reading, with per-field validation and success/error feedback.
frontend/src/utils/vitalsSimulator.ts: Generates physiologically plausible simulated vitals readings by drifting values around a baseline with mean-reversion, returning a timestamped reading object.
frontend/src/utils/vitalsThresholds.ts: Defines normal/warning/critical thresholds for each vital sign and exports helper functions to evaluate a reading's status and retrieve reference ranges.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the default theme with custom color palettes (teal, navy, status), fonts, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Tracks the project state, version, architectural notes, known issues, and a list of existing implemented features for a 24/7 vitals monitoring app.
